title: Sick toddler dies after 'dad blows donation cash on brothels, holidays and drugs’

A dying toddler has died after his dad allegedly blew his crowd-funding cash on luxury trips and brothels.

The father of the two-year-old boy has been arrested in July on suspicion of spending nearly BRL 600,000 (£114,060) of money raised online by kind donors.

Brazilian Mate Mateus Henrique Leroy Alves, 37, is accused of using the cash that donors had given to help treat his son’s rare degenerative disease.

He is accused of splashing the cash on a luxury lifestyle that included high-rolling holidays, drugs and brothels.

(Image: CEN/@amejoaomiguelcl)

(Image: CEN/@amejoaomiguelcl)

And now the boy the money was intended for has died.

Two-year-old Joao Miguel suffered from type 1 spinal muscular atrophy, a serious degenerative disease and Joao has now died.

The little boy's plight was documented on an Instagram page with more than 17,000 followers.

Suspicions over Alves' spending began after he allegedly using the cash for a luxury trip from his home in the town of Conselheiro Lafaiete to the city of Salvador in the eastern Brazilian state of Bahia without his wife.

(Image: CEN/Globo)

(Image: CEN/@amejoaomiguelcl)

Karine Rodrigues raised the alarm after her husband gave her information that led her to become suspicious, and the police told her to check the funds raised for their son.

Mrs Rodrigues allegedly found large amounts had been withdrawn from the fund meant for the couple's son.

Alves was arrested after three days away on the luxury holiday.

According to reports, Alves is suspected of spending some of the money on watches, designer clothing, drink, drugs and expensive aftershave.

Local media reports he is alleged to have “invested” 50,000 BRL (£9,495) in a brothel in Conselheiro Lafaiete.

(Image: Globo)

However it is unclear whether the money is suspected of having come from the donation fund

Investigator Daniel Gomes said Alves had been charged with larceny and material neglect of his family.

Gomes added: “He remains in detention. There has already been a hearing… the sentence is scheduled to be released next month.”

The fund had reportedly raised 1,000,000 BRL (£189,900) for Joao Migue,l who needed a medication called Spinraza to stop his disease advancing.

Each dose of the drug costs 341,000 BRL (£65, 420).

(Image: Globo)

The toddler was able to receive the first dose of the medication in August after the government agreed to pay for the first three rounds of the treatment in light of the allegations against his father.

However, he tragically died last week after his condition rapidly worsened at home.



He was rushed to hospital but died of a heart attack, according to Gomes.

Spinal muscular atrophy is a group of neuromuscular disorders that result in the loss of motor neurons and progressive muscle wasting.

The investigation into his father's handling of the donations is ongoing.
description: Brazilian father Mate Mateus Henrique Leroy Alves, 37, is accused of splashing the cash meant for his dying boy on a luxury lifestyle
